turns.content: Can you suggest indoor kid-friendly activities in Barrie, Ontario for rainy/snowy days?

1. Visit the MacLaren Art Centre and participate in one of their family-friendly workshops or events.

2. Do some indoor rock climbing at Alt Rock in Barrie.

3. Go bowling at Bowlerama Barrie.

4. Visit Flying Monkeys Craft Brewery and enjoy a brewery tour and tasting (for the parents) while the kids enjoy their root beer.

5. Catch a movie at the Galaxy Cinemas Barrie.

6. Try indoor go-karting at SODI Racing.

7. Visit the Simcoe County Museum and explore the interactive exhibits.

8. Spend a fun-filled day at the Barrie Sports Dome.

9. Play laser tag at Laser Tag Explosion.

10. Visit the Barrie Public Library and participate in their reading programs and activities.
Wow, these are all great suggestions! I had no idea there was so much to do in Barrie on rainy/snowy days. Which one do you think would be the most fun for kids under 10?

As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions or preferences. However, based on the activities mentioned, children under 10 years old might enjoy the interactive exhibits at the Simcoe County Museum, indoor rock climbing at Alt Rock, bowling at Bowlerama Barrie, or the workshops and events at the MacLaren Art Center.
That's helpful, but I'm looking for something a little more hands-on or active for my energetic kids. Do you have any other suggestions?

Sure! Here are some hands-on and active activities in Barrie, Ontario that might interest your energetic kids:

1. Jump around at Big Fun Play Centre
2. Trampoline Jumping at Flying Squirrel
3. Have fun at Laserforce Laser Tag
4. Try the Ninja Warrior course and other activities at Jump in Trampoline Park
5. Visit the Barrie Area Indoor Playground
6. Go ice-skating at the Barrie Molson Centre.
